history.content:
1. No

2. Depends on if you're an international student, NCAA student athlete, or receive financial aid? 

3. True, unless you're an international student or NCAA student athlete

Edit (from Elad): If you aren't doing as well as you would have liked in 16A, it's pretty unlikely that you will do better in 16B. At a minimum you would need to figure out what went wrong for you in 16A (in terms of your approach to learning the material in the class, the concepts you have gaps on, or both).  Finally, if you qualify for the clobber, your grade might be substantially higher than your midterm scores (depending on how well you do on the final as compared to the midterms).  Finally, note also that I believe you would need to take both Math 54 and 16B (not just 16B) to fulfill the requirement.  (Of course, you can also fulfill the requirement with 16A + 16B.)

1. No

2. Depends on if you're an international student, NCAA student athlete, or receive financial aid? 

3. True, unless you're an international student or NCAA student athlete

children.subject: If you late drop using the form it will not appear in your transcipt
If we were to take this option, would this class still show up on our transcript or would it show as a Withdrawal?

history.content:
I don't like the grade I'm most likely going to end up with in 16A this semester.
I was thinking of late dropping it and taking 16B next semester and that way fulfill the Math 54 + 16A or 16B lower div requirement for L&S CS. I had some questions regarding this:

1. Is there a rule against this course of action?

2. Late dropping EE16A would put me under the unit minimum but from what I can understand, this shouldn't be a problem, correct?

3. Would I only need my own signature to turn in the form because I am undeclared as of right now?

Here is the form for reference: https://ls.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/advlatechangeclassschedule.pdf
history.subject: Late Dropping 16A and taking 16B instead

history.content:
I don't like the grade I'm most likely going to end up with in 16A this semester.
I was thinking of late dropping it and taking 16B next semester and that way fulfill the Math 54 + 16A or 16B lower div requirement for L&S CS.

I just wanted to make sure there's no rule against this? Moreover, late dropping EE16A would put me under the unit minimum but from what I can understand, this shouldn't be a problem.
